intro: Canthium bibracteatum, commonly known as the two-bract canthium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive two bracts at the base of its inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a rough texture. Canthium bibracteatum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
